alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:00AM PST until January 09 at 5:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Navarro River at Navarro affecting Mendocino County. For the Navarro River...including Navarro...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navarro River at Navarro. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 128 approximately 5 miles east of Highway 1 is certain and the road will be closed. Motorists should use alternate routes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM PST Monday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 24.6 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 16.3 feet. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.7 feet on 01/18/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM PST.
